org.zaproxy.zap.extension.spider

Class ExtensionSpider

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.parosproxy.paros.extension.ExtensionAdaptor
      • org.zaproxy.zap.extension.spider.ExtensionSpider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Extension, SessionChangedListener, ScanController<SpiderScan>

    public class ExtensionSpider
extends ExtensionAdaptor
implements SessionChangedListener, ScanController<SpiderScan>
    The ExtensionSpider is the Extension that controls the Spider.

      • getActiveActions

        public List<String> getActiveActions()
        Description copied from interface: Extension
        Returns the (internationalised) names of all active actions of the extension - if there are any the user will be given the option not to exit ZAP or, if the extension is bundled in an add-on that's being updated or uninstalled, not to continue with the changes.

        An active action is something that's started by the user, for example, a scan.

        Specified by:
        getActiveActions in interface Extension
        Overrides:
        getActiveActions in class ExtensionAdaptor
        Returns:
        a List containing the active actions or null if none
        See Also:
        Extension.getUnsavedResources()

      • sessionAboutToChange

        public void sessionAboutToChange(Session session)
        Description copied from interface: SessionChangedListener
        Called just prior to the session changing. Listeners should close down any resources associaited with this session. sessionAboutToChange may be called by non-event thread. Should handle with care in all the listener. Use EventThread for each GUI event.
        Specified by:
        sessionAboutToChange in interface SessionChangedListener

      • addCustomParser

        public void addCustomParser(SpiderParser parser)
        Adds a new custom Spider Parser. The parser is added at the beginning of the parsers list so it will be processed before other already loaded parsers and before the default parsers.

        This method should be used to customize the Spider from any other extension of ZAP. The parsers added will be loaded whenever starting any scan.

        Parameters:
        parser - the parser

      • addCustomFetchFilter

        public void addCustomFetchFilter(FetchFilter filter)
        Adds a custom fetch filter that would be used during the spidering.

        This method should be used to customize the Spider from any other extension of ZAP. The filters added will be loaded whenever starting any scan.

        Parameters:
        filter - the filter

      • addCustomParseFilter

        public void addCustomParseFilter(ParseFilter filter)
        Adds a custom parse filter that would be used during the spidering.

        This method should be used to customize the Spider from any other extension of ZAP. The filters added will be loaded whenever starting any scan.

        Parameters:
        filter - the filter

      • startScan

        public int startScan(Target target,
            User user,
            Object[] customConfigurations)
        Starts a new spider scan using the given target and, optionally, spidering from the perspective of a user and with custom configurations.

        The spider scan will use the most appropriate display name created from the given target, user and custom configurations.

        Parameters:
        target - the target that will be spidered
        user - the user that will be used to spider, might be null
        customConfigurations - other custom configurations for the spider, might be null
        Returns:
        the ID of the spider scan
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the target or custom configurations are not allowed in the current mode.
        Since:
        2.5.0
        See Also:
        startScan(String, Target, User, Object[])

      • startScan

        public int startScan(String displayName,
            Target target,
            User user,
            Object[] customConfigurations)
        Starts a new spider scan, with the given display name, using the given target and, optionally, spidering from the perspective of a user and with custom configurations.

        Note: The preferred method to start the scan is with startScan(Target, User, Object[]), unless a custom display name is really needed.

        Specified by:
        startScan in interface ScanController<SpiderScan>
        Parameters:
        target - the target that will be spidered
        user - the user that will be used to spider, might be null
        customConfigurations - other custom configurations for the spider, might be null
        Returns:
        the ID of the spider scan
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the target or custom configurations are not allowed in the current mode.

      • getTargetUriOutOfScope

        protected String getTargetUriOutOfScope(Target target)
        Returns the first URI that is out of scope in the given target.
        Parameters:
        target - the target that will be checked
        Returns:
        a String with the first URI out of scope, null if none found
        Since:
        2.5.0
        See Also:
        Session.isInScope(String)

      • getTargetUriOutOfScope

        protected String getTargetUriOutOfScope(Target target,
                            Object[] contextSpecificObjects)
        Returns the first URI that is out of scope in the given target or contextSpecificObjects.
        Parameters:
        target - the target that will be checked
        contextSpecificObjects - other Objects used to enhance the target
        Returns:
        a String with the first URI out of scope, null if none found
        Since:
        2.5.0
        See Also:
        Session.isInScope(String)

      • isTargetUriInScope

        protected boolean isTargetUriInScope(String uri)
        Tells whether or not the given uri is in scope.
        Parameters:
        uri - the uri that will be checked
        Returns:
        true if the uri is in scope, false otherwise
        Since:
        2.5.0
        See Also:
        Session.isInScope(String)

      • supportsLowMemory

        public boolean supportsLowMemory()
        Description copied from interface: Extension
        Return true it the extension can run with the 'low memory' option. If the low memory option is set (and the extension supports it) then code should minimize the data stored in memory, using the db for all significant data. Extensions that do not support the low memory option will not be run if the option is set.
        Specified by:
        supportsLowMemory in interface Extension
        Overrides:
        supportsLowMemory in class ExtensionAdaptor
        Returns:

      • supportsDb

        public boolean supportsDb(String type)
        No database tables used, so all supported
        Specified by:
        supportsDb in interface Extension
        Overrides:
        supportsDb in class ExtensionAdaptor
        Parameters:
        type - the db type
        Returns:
        true if the specified db type is supported by the extension (or if it doesnt use any db)
        See Also:
        Database.getType()
